Header: Saudi king says Iran actions threaten regional, global security
Content: Saudi Arabia convened emergency Arab summits to deliver a strong message to Iran over regional security after recent attacks on Gulf oil assets, as American officials said a U.S. military deployment had deterred Tehran. Saudi King Salman told a Gulf Arab meeting, ahead of a separate Arab summit, that Iran’s development of nuclear and missile capabilities and its threatening of global oil supplies posed a risk to regional and international security. Saudi Arabia and the UAE, which have lobbied Washington to contain their foe, Shi’ite Muslim Iran, have said they want to avoid war after drone strikes on oil pumping stations in the kingdom and the sabotage of tankers off the UAE coast.
